description: From the Athenian lawmaker Draco, from Latin Dracō, from Ancient Greek Δράκων (Drákōn), known for making harsh laws. See δράκων (drákōn, “dragon”).

adjectives.description: draconian (comparative more draconian, superlative most draconian)

examples: The mayor announced draconian budget cuts today.

adjectives.description: draconian (comparative more draconian, superlative most draconian)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, except in fiction) Of or resembling a dragon.
